nodes.bodyText: I created this abstraction because if the PR is approved, I'm planning to follow the same approach for Kafka. So, Kafka would reuse the same mechanism to enable/disable the container.

nodes.bodyText: Integration tests should use failsafe plugin instead of surefire (which should be used for unit tests only). However, I didn't want to do any unrelated changes as part of this PR.

@jstastny-cz should this be a follow-up PR or you happy to be fixed in here.
either way is fine for me.
I don't mind either. I'd just create Jira for this and wrap this up quickly. @Sgitario do you have one? If not, please create and link the issue in this comment thread for future reference.
I changed the sasl-mechanism to "PLAIN" as some tests were failing using DIGEST (a missing property probably). I guess using "PLAIN" should be fine.
I set the SASL mechanism to "PLAIN" and added the "AUTH-REALM" to "default" as some tests did need it to work.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,77 @@
+# Common Utils For Kogito Examples
+
+## Infinispan Test Containers Support
+
+Add the common utils dependency in the _pom.xml_ file:
+
+```xml
+<dependency>
+  <groupId>org.kie.kogito</groupId>
+  <artifactId>common-example-utils</artifactId>
+  <scope>test</scope>
+</dependency>
+```
+
+### Usage in a Quarkus test:
+
+Example:
+
+```java
+@QuarkusTest
+@QuarkusTestResource(InfinispanQuarkusResource.class)
+public class MyTest {
+   // ...
+}
+```
+
+And add the Infinispan properties in the _application.properties_:
+
+```
+#Infinispan
+quarkus.infinispan-client.server-list=localhost:11222
+quarkus.infinispan-client.use-auth=true
+quarkus.infinispan-client.auth-username=admin
+quarkus.infinispan-client.auth-password=admin
+```
+
+In case we want to run the container only if some requirements are met, we need to use it this way:
+
+```java
+@QuarkusTestResource(value = InfinispanQuarkusResource.class, initArgs = {@ResourceArg(name = "enableIfTestCategoryIs", value = "persistence")})
+```
+
+### Usage in Spring Boot test:
+
+
+```java
+@Testcontainers
+@ExtendWith(SpringExtension.class)
+@SpringBootTest(webEnvironment = SpringBootTest.WebEnvironment.RANDOM_PORT, classes = DemoApplication.class)
+@DirtiesContext(classMode = ClassMode.AFTER_EACH_TEST_METHOD) // reset spring context after each test method
+public class MyTest {
+    @Container
+    public static GenericContainer<?> INFINISPAN = new InfinispanContainer();
+    
+    // ...
+}
+```
+
+And add the Infinispan properties in the _application.properties_:
+
+```
+# Infinispan
+infinispan.remote.server-list=localhost:11222
+infinispan.remote.sasl-mechanism=PLAIN
+infinispan.remote.auth-server-name=infinispan
+infinispan.remote.use-auth=true
+infinispan.remote.auth-realm=default
+infinispan.remote.auth-username=admin
+infinispan.remote.auth-password=admin

nodes.bodyText: I see that this is using TABs, that's why this format issue. Should I reformat the whole file? (I will result in much more changes...)
I see that this is using TABs, that's why this format issue. Should I reformat the whole file? (I will result in much more changes...)
fine as is, probably is best to do a new PR with just the reformat after merging this.
please move dependencyManagement to before dependencies for better readbility
